text: Applejack, help! Spike's running wild and I need you to lasso him!

speaker: Applejack
text: [laughs] Oh, that's a good one, Twilight. Sweet little Spike, running wild. Ha, what a laugh.

speaker: Applejack
text: Twilight, get my rope.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
Applejack
text: Help!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Huh? [laughs] Don't tell me! You-you tied yourselves up?

speaker: Applejack
text: Get us out of here right now!

speaker: Applejack
text: [gasps] What was that?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Sounded like Fluttershy to me!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Fluttershy? Fluttershy!?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I'm up here!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: What happened?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I was helping my squirrel friends with a dance step, and all of a sudden, a giant, r-rampaging d-d-d-dragon stormed through!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: That was Spike!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Spike? But why would Spike steal my chicken coop? He just pulled it out of the ground and filled it with a bunch of apples and stuff!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: That sounded like Pinkie Pie!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: C'mon, girls!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Back! Get back!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Pinkie Pie! Stop giving him cake!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I'm not giving him cake, I'm *assaulting* him with cake!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: How dare you take the cake!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: He's completely out of control! Who knows where he'll go next!

speaker: Rarity
text: [hums] Hm, perhaps some more ruffle. [screams]

speaker: Rarity
text: Put me down, you brute!

speaker: Rarity
text: How rude.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Don't worry Rarity, we'll save you!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Put her down, right now!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I-If you wouldn't mind, that is...

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I mean it, dragon boy!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: We'll be ever so grateful if you'd be so kind as to possibly consider...

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Drop her, scaly!

speaker: Rarity
text: Hey! I'm– not some– sort of common– fly swatter!

speaker: Rarity
text: Girls! *My cape*!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Look! The Wonderbolts!

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, be quiet. You've got nothing to be proud of. You steal everypony's things, terrorize the town, and use *me* as a weapon against my own friends! Which, as horrible as it is, I can almost understand because you're a dragon and all. But *this*! [rips off dress] *This* is a *crime against fashion*! Oh no. You are not getting *this* gemstone! This was given to me by my dear friend Spikey-wikey, the kindest, sweetest, most generous dragon ever. And it is too precious to me to give to a greedy old beast like you!

speaker: Spike
text: Here, Rarity, you take it. It would mean even more to see you happy than to eat it myself.

speaker: Rarity
text: I... I don't know what to say. This is just so generous. [kisses]

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, what now? I suppose you'll be eating me or something? Spike?! *You're* the rampaging dragon?!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Somepony do something!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: On it!

speaker: Spike
text: Rarity? I need to tell you something! Just in case we don't make it! I've always sort of had a crush–

speaker: Fluttershy
text: [gasps] We did it! I can't believe we did it!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: All in a day's work.

speaker: Rarity
text: Spike, I just have to tell you how absolutely proud I am of you.

speaker: Spike
text: Proud of *me*?

speaker: Rarity
text: Yes. It was you who stopped... w-well, you, from destroying Ponyville. You are my hero, Spikey-wikey! [kisses]

speaker: Spike
text: *Dear Princess Celestia,*

speaker: Spike
text: *Today I learned a great lesson about friendship. Well, you might think that it would feel good to get lots and lots of stuff, but it doesn't feel nearly as good as giving something special to somepony you really care about. But I learned that it truly is better to give than to receive, and that kindness and generosity are what lead to true friendship. And that's more valuable than anything in the world.* Well... almost anything.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: We're getting closer!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I can hardly wait!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I'm so excited, I-I feel like shouting! [softly] Woo-hoo!

speaker: Applejack
text: Hooo-wee! Canterlot, here we come!

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, I do hope I look festive enough!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: There it is! Canterlot!

speaker: Fluttershy
Rainbow Dash
Pinkie Pie
Applejack
Rarity
Twilight Sparkle
text: Oooh...

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh, isn't Canterlot wonderful this time of year?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Yeah, I wish it was Hearth's Warming Eve every day.

speaker: Applejack
text: There's so much to look at! I feel like my durned eyes are gonna pop right out of my head!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I have an idea, let's play 'I spy with my little eye' as we walk! I'll go first. I spy... an eight-foot candy cane.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I spy a snowpony!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I spy somepony eating a gingerbread house...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [munching] ...and it's me!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I can't believe that Princess Celestia chose *us* to put on the most important play of the season! Do you guys know what an honor this is? For all of us?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Oh, I wish she hadn't honored me quite so much... I can't go onstage! *I don't want everypony looking at me*!

speaker: Rarity
text: Fluttershy, darling, there's nothing to feel nervous about.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: No?

speaker: Rarity
text: Of course not. All across Equestria, ponies are preparing their own pageants for Hearth's Warming Eve in their own towns. It's tradition.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: So you're saying they'll be too busy to come to *our* play?

speaker: Rarity
text: Well, no. We're in the Canterlot pageant, the biggest, most important production in all of Equestria. A *lot* of ponies will come to watch us.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: A lot?

speaker: Rarity
text: Hundreds.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Hundreds?

speaker: Rarity
text: [gasps] Maybe even thousands!

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, my hair! Applejack? Be a dear and shut those windows, will you?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Aaah! Rain-bow-Dash! Rain-bow-Dash! Aaaah! Thank you, thank you!

speaker: Applejack
text: It's a reenactment of the founding of Equestria. It's not the 'Rainbow Dash Show'.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Well it *should* be the 'Rainbow Dash Show'! *I'm* the star!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Fluttershy, you've got to come out of there!

speaker: Spike
text: Curtain in two minutes!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Twilight, let me handle this.

speaker: Rarity
text: My hair!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *PINKIE*!

speaker: Applejack
text: The Hearth's Warming Eve pageant is about harmony and friendship.

speaker: Other main cast
text: *Shut the window*!

speaker: Spike
text: [with a faux British accent] Once upon a time, long before the peaceful rule of Celestia, and before ponies discovered our beautiful land of Equestria, ponies did not know harmony. It was a strange and dark time. A time when ponies were torn apart... by hatred!

speaker: Spike
text: [normal voice] I know. Can you believe it? [accent] During this frightful age, each of the three tribes – the Pegasi, the unicorns, and the Earth ponies – cared not for what befell the other tribes, but only for their own welfare. In those troubled times, as now, the Pegasi were the stewards of the weather. But they demanded something in return. Food that could only be grown by the Earth ponies.

speaker: Spike
text: The unicorns demanded the same, in return for magically bringing forth day and night. And so, mistrust between the tribes festered, until one fateful day, it came to a boil. And what prompted the ponies to clash? 'Twas a mysterious blizzard that overtook the land, and toppled the tribes' precarious peace.

speaker: Spike
text: The normally industrious Earth ponies were unable to farm their land.

speaker: Spike
text: The Earth ponies were freezing. The home of the Pegasi fared no better. The Pegasi were hungry. And the unicorns were freezing *and* hungry. Even the unicorns' magic was powerless against the storm. Each tribe blamed the others for their suffering, and the angrier everypony grew, the worse the blizzard became. And so it was decided that a grand summit would be held to figure out a way to cope with the blizzard.

speaker: Spike
text: Each tribe sent their leaders.

speaker: Spike
text: Daughter of the unicorn king, Princess Platinum.

speaker: Spike
text: Ruler of the Pegasi, Commander Hurricane. And lastly...

speaker: Spike
text: ...leader of the Earth ponies, Chancellor Puddinghead. Perhaps the three tribes could finally settle their differences, and agree on a way to get through this disaster.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: All I wanna know is why the Earth ponies are hogging all the food!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: *Us*?! We're not hogging all the food, *you* are! Oh, wait. You're right. It's us. Well, it's only 'cause you mean old Pegasusususes are making it *snow like crazy*!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: For the hundredth time, it's not us! We're not making it snow! It must be the unicorns! They're doing it with their freaky magic!

speaker: Rarity
text: [gasps] How *dare* you! Unlike you Pegasi ruffians, we unicorns would never stoop to such a thing! H-m-ph!

speaker: Unicorns
text: Hmph!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Well, if you non-Earths aren't gonna stop using your weirdo powers to freeze us all, then I'm just plum out of ideas.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: What a shocker. An Earth pony with no ideas.

speaker: Rarity
text: Commander Hurricane, please cease with the insults!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: You're not the boss of me, your royal snootiness!

speaker: Rarity
text: *I beg your pardon*?! I am a princess! I won't be spoken to that way!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Well, I'm leaving first!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: No, *I'm* first!

speaker: Spike
text: And the blizzard raged on.

speaker: Spike
text: So the summit of the tribes did not turn out as well as hoped, and the three leaders returned home to lick their wounds, and basically complain.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Atten-tion! Well? Aren't you curious about how it went?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Oh! Commander Hurricane, sir! How did it go, sir?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: *Horribly*! Those other tribe leaders are so disrespectful! Don't they realize that we are a mighty tribe of warriors, and should not be crossed? We have got to break ranks with those weak foals!

speaker: Rarity
text: [shivering] Clover the Clever! I need you!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Yes, your Majesty. Did the other pony tribes see reason as I predicted?

speaker: Rarity
text: Those other tribes are impossible! I, for one, can no longer bear to be anywhere near those lowly creatures. The unicorns are noble and majestic. We will no longer consort with the likes of them!

speaker: Applejack
text: Wouldn't it have been easier to use the door, Chancellor?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Maybe for you, Smart Cookie. But *I* am a chancellor. I was elected because I know how to think outside the box. Which means [slightly echoes] I can also think *inside the chimney*. Can *you* think inside a chimney?

speaker: Applejack
text: Uh...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I didn't think so.

speaker: Applejack
text: Ugh.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ohmygosh. Hold on to your hooves! I am *just about to be brilliant*!

speaker: Applejack
text: [under her breath] That'd be a first.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I have decided that the Earth ponies are gonna go it alone!

speaker: Applejack
text: Aw, so you mean the other tribes didn't come around? Shoot... I really thought we could get through to 'em if we–

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Don't worry about them. We're the ones with all the food, *right*?

speaker: Applejack
text: Actually, we're all out.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Fine, then we'll have to go somewhere new where we can grow some new food. And with me as our fearless leader, what could go wrong?

speaker: Applejack
text: [under her breath] Where should I start?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: The point is...

speaker: Rainbow Dash
Rarity
Pinkie Pie
text: We must find a new land!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: C'mon, Private Pansy, let's get a move on! Hup-one, hup-two!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Get a hold of yourself, Private! We cannot let anything distract us from the mission at hand. To find, and if necessary, to conquer a new land!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Conquer, sir?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: You never know where enemies might be lurking.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I don't see any enemies, Commander. Just... snow.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: A-ha! What's that?! [fighting noises]

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Okay. This is getting old.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, this is simply taking forever. My hooves are killing me! How long have we been walking for?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: About five minutes, your highness.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, I never imagined finding a new land would be so hard. But it'll all be worth it, don't you agree?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I actually think that the three tribes could've tried harder.

speaker: Rarity
text: *Stoooooop*!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Rarity
text: *That* is what's wrong!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Your Highness, it's just a stream. We can cross it easily.

speaker: Rarity
text: I refuse to get my gown wet. I have no intention of arriving at my new land looking like a bedraggled Earth pony, or worse yet a rough-and-tumble *Pegasus*. I, for one, have no intention of stooping down to their level. On the other hand, I have no trouble watching *you* stoop down.

speaker: Rarity
text: And do watch the gown, darling. It's worth more than *all* of the books in your library.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yes, yes. This is definitely the right direction.

speaker: Applejack
text: It feels like we're going in circles.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: But that's impossible. Are you suggesting that I'm reading the map wrong?

speaker: Applejack
text: Absolutely not, your chancellorness. It's just that there are holes in the map, and–

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Of course! How else could I see where I was going?

speaker: Applejack
text: Yeah, uh–

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Or talk? I need to be able to talk! I mean, how would we survive if I just suddenly shut up?

speaker: Applejack
text: Heaven forbid that should happen, your chancellorship. Heh. It's just that... the map is also upside down.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I got a newsflash for you, Cookie. The Earth is round. There is no up or down.

speaker: Applejack
text: You're right! It's *such* a relief to me that you're in charge of this map...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Relief? You don't need relief! If anypony needs relief around here, it's me! I'm a chancellor! I'm a bigshot! You're just my, um... my, uh...

speaker: Applejack
text: Secretary.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Whatever. You take the map, while I enjoy some relief.

speaker: Applejack
text: Yes, Chancellor Puddinghead.

speaker: Spike
text: [accent] And so, each leader encountered obstacles along the way, but eventually, they all arrived in a new and wondrous land. Nopony had ever seen paradise before.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: This is the new land we've been searching for!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: What a view... I can see my future house from here.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I proclaim this new land to be... *Pegasopolis*!

speaker: Rarity
text: I've never seen such jewels! This ruby is dazzling. This whole *land* is dazzling. I'm double dazzled! [squeals] In the name of the unicorns, I hereby dub this land *Unicornia*!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: The air! The trees! The dirt! This dirt is the dirtiest dirt in the whole dirt world!

speaker: Applejack
text: And fertile, too. Perfect for growing food.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: In the name of the Earth ponies, I think I'm gonna call this new place... uh... *Dirtville*.

speaker: Applejack
text: How about "Earth"?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: *Earth*! Congratulations to me for thinking of it.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
Rarity
Pinkie Pie
text: We found our new home!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I planted my flag first!

speaker: Rarity
text: Did not!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Did too!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I planted mine earlier than first.

speaker: Rarity
text: All of you riffraff are trespassing in Unicornia!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: The name is Pegasopolis!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Earth!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Pegasopolis!

speaker: Rarity
text: Unicornia!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I say we fight for the land. May the best pony win!

speaker: Rarity
text: That's barbaric. Clover the Clever? Throw that brute into the dungeon!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: What dungeon? Look, perhaps if we all calmed down...

speaker: Applejack
text: I agree. Let's all calm down.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I vote for calm.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I'll have you court-martialed for insubordination, Private! We settle this on the battlefield!

speaker: Rarity
text: Who *dares* throw a snowball at royalty?!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Wait a minute, where'd all this snow come from anyway?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Oh no. Not again.

speaker: Spike
text: [accent] And so the paradise that the ponies had found was soon lost, buried beneath a thick blanket of snow *and* hard feelings. Instead of beautiful, it was blizzardy. Instead of wonderful, it was wintry! Instead of spectacular, it was snow-tacular! Instead of–

speaker: Shoeshine
text: We get it! Move on!

speaker: Spike
text: [laughs nervously] [clears throat] [accent] Everypony was forced to seek shelter. They searched high and low, but the only shelter for miles was a cold and desolate cave. And, of course, the three tribes had to share it, and nopony was too happy about that.

speaker: Rarity
text: Please, Commander Hothead.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: It's Commander Hurricane.

speaker: Rarity
text: [clears throat] Please, *Commander*, could you just stand back and give me my royal space?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: You mean like *this*, your highness?

speaker: Rarity
text: Indeed not! You see this invisible line?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Private? Outline our territory for everypony to see. See this real, *non*-invisible line? No unicorns *or* Earth ponies are allowed to cross it! This is the sovereign territory of Pegasopolis!

speaker: Rarity
text: Clover the Clever?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Uh... Smart Cookie!

speaker: Applejack
text: I know, I know.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: What are you doing? Don't go around the rock, go over it! I'm not giving up an inch of territory to the enemy!

speaker: Rarity
text: That rock is clearly on the Unicornia side of the cave, and it belongs to us! [under her breath] Who knows? there could be jewels inside.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [groans] I claim this rock for Pegasopolis!

speaker: Rarity
text: Unhand that rock this instant, you scoundrel!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh, look, you found my rock. I've been looking for it everywhere.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Hey! You invaded our territory!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Finders keepers, losers weepers!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: That's the last straw!

speaker: Rarity
text: *Give me my rock*!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Look, everypony! The entrance!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Great. Now there's no way out! We're trapped!

speaker: Rarity
text: You two deserve this horrible fate. You've done nothing but argue and fight with each other!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: You've been fighting too, *your Highness*.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yeah! Worse! I haven't been fighting nearly as much as you!

speaker: Rarity
text: How ridiculous! A unicorn never stoops to fighting!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: That's just 'cause you wimpy unicorns know you'd never win! Earth ponies are numbskulls!

speaker: Rarity
text: Pegasi are brutes!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Unicorns are snobs!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: W-W-What is that... thing?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: They must be... windigos!

speaker: Fluttershy
Applejack
text: Windigos?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: My mentor Star Swirl the Bearded taught me about them. They're winter spirits that feed off fighting and hatred. The more hate the spirit feels, the colder things become!

speaker: Applejack
text: Then... this is our fault. We three tribes... we brought this blizzard to our home by fightin' and not trustin' each other. Now it's destroyin' this land, too.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: And now our bodies will become as cold as our hearts... *all because we were foolish enough to hate.*

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Well, I don't hate *you*... I actually hate Commander Hurricane a lot more than I hate you guys.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Actually, I don't really hate her, I just really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really dislike her.

speaker: Applejack
text: Well, I don't hate you guys either.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Nor do I.

speaker: Applejack
text: No matter what our differences, we're all ponies.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: What was that?

speaker: Applejack
text: I didn't know unicorns could do that.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I didn't either. Nothing like this has ever happened before. But I know it couldn't have been just me. It came from all three of us, joined together, in friendship.

speaker: Spike
text: [accent] All through the night, the three ponies kept the fire of friendship alive by telling stories to one another and by singing songs, which of course became the winter carols that we all still sing today. Eventually, the warmth of the fire and singing and laughing reached the leaders, and their bodies began to thaw. [normal voice] And it even began to melt their hearts.

speaker: Spike
text: [accent] The three leaders agreed to share the beautiful land, and live in harmony ever afterwards. And together, they named their new land...

speaker: Fluttershy
Rainbow Dash
Pinkie Pie
Applejack
Rarity
Twilight Sparkle
text: *Equestria*!

speaker: Choir
text:
The fire of friendship lives in our hearts
As long as it burns, we cannot drift apart
Though quarrels arise, their numbers are few
Laughter and singing will see us through (will see us through)
We are a circle of pony friends
A circle of friends we'll be to the very end

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: We should be so honored that Princess Celestia chose *us*! She must really think we exemplify what good friends are!

speaker: Rarity
text: Applejack, I thought you closed all the windows.

speaker: Applejack
text: Don't blame me. Rainbow Dash should've flown up there and shut it. After all, she's got wings.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Why do I always have to do all the high up chores? Why can't Twilight use her magic for a change!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Y'know what? I got it.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: The timberwolves are a-howlin'! The timberwolves are a-howlin'!

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Eeyup.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: The zap apples are comin'! The zap apples are comin'!

speaker: Big McIntosh
Applejack
Apple Bloom
text: Yay, the zap apples are comin'!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: That's what I said.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Hey, silly goose! Quit your gawkin' and move your caboose!

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Eeyup.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Ready, Granny!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Ready for what?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: For makin' zap apple jam!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Darn tootin'! It's time for some good old-fashioned zap apple jammin'!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Yes, ma'am. I can't wait, ma'am!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: [pause] Wait for what?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: To make zap apple jam with you!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: O'course. Now I been doing this ever since I was a little pony, so be warned, pickle pear. There's a whole mess o' steps in this process and you gots to get each one of them just right, or *no zap apple jam*. Take this.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Uh, is this one of your gazillion secret herbal ingredients for the zap apple jam?

speaker: Granny Smith
text: That there's a broom. Now get sweepin', pipsqueak! Now while you sweep, I'll get to, uh... something there... umm... Oh, ponyfeathers. Bet I'd forget my mane if it wasn't attached to my head.

speaker: Applejack
text: There's the zap apple leaves, right on schedule!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L-M-N-O-P...

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Well, howdy-doo there, Filthy Rich!

speaker: Filthy Rich
text: Hello, Mrs. Smith. Did I hear right that there's a zap apple harvest coming in a few days?

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Four days, to be exact.

speaker: Filthy Rich
text: Excellent news, and as usual, I get your first hundred jars?

speaker: Granny Smith
text: 'Course, Filthy.

speaker: Filthy Rich
text: Uh, I prefer Rich.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Oh, and how is your pappy doin'?

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: Oh, you poor, poor thing, having to make all that zap apple jam with Granny Smith.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Actually, I been looking forward to making zap apple jam for years!

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: I'm not talking about the jam. I'm talking about Granny Smith! You must be sooo embarrassed.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: [muffled] Soup's on!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Uh, what do ya mean?

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: You know, with all her silly ways, how she forgets things, and makes you wear these ridiculous costumes?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Granny said that the water needs–

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: Thank goodness you're here on the farm and not in town where everypony could see you. [hushed] Don't worry. Your secret is safe with me.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: "Silly ways"?

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Uh, thank you kindly, Filthy!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Shake a leg there, slowpoke! We got a gaggle's worth of goods to gather before the harvest. Come on! [singing to the tune of "*Skip to My Lou*"] Gonna make zap apple jam, hoop-dee-hoo! Gatherin' my goodies now, hoop-dee-hee! Singin' and dancin', diddley-hoo, flippity-floo, my darlin! [voice cracks] They don't make 'em like they used to. [chomp]

speaker: Daisy
text: Hey! You bite it, you buy it!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: [muffled] Whoo! Why, hello, Bea, Beatrice, Beecher! Ooh, you've all been busy little bees, haven't you? [buzzes]

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Granny, isn't there a less... silly way to get the honey? [gasps]

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Oh, isn't this just precious?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Please stop!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: And it is perfect for makin' our zap apple jam!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Shh! Stop it, Granny!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Granny, please! Those ponies over there are watchin' me!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: What? Are those fillies your friends? Hello, Half-pint's friends!

speaker: Silver Spoon
text: Hiii, Granny Smith! Hiii, [mockingly] Half-pint!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: What dolls. Why, when I was little, ponies didn't come that purdy.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Are we done shopping, Granny? 'Cause I'd like to get back to the farm, fast.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: All done, smellybelly. [singing] I got my honey, gooey-goo! Got my honey, gooey-ooh! Got my honey, iddley-hoo!

speaker: Filthy Rich
text: And, by capturing the whole sale market, purchasing in bulk and slashing all prices, we undermine every other gift market in town, and that's how Rich's Barnyard Bargains became the cornerstone of retail in Ponyville.

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Well, thank you, Mr. Filthy—I mean, Mr. Rich. What a wonderful day of sharing! And thank you for being a part of Family Appreciation Day! Now, uh, let's see who will be bringing in a family member for next Monday's Family Appreciation Day. Um... Oh! Apple Bloom!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: But Miss Cheerilee. Monday is zap apple harvest day, and Applejack and Big McIntosh will be too busy to come and speak.

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Well, is there anypony else in your family that could–

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: Miss Cheerilee. Apple Bloom's Granny Smith isn't working harvest. She could come.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Oh! But, uh, no, that wouldn't–

speaker: Cheerilee
text: That's a splendid idea, Diamond Tiara! Apple Bloom, you shall bring in Granny Smith on Monday.

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Have a great weekend, everypony!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Granny Smith? Come Monday, I'll be the laughin' stock of Ponyville!

speaker: Applejack
text: I'm sorry, Apple Bloom. I already told you that we just can't take a break from harvest to come to your school. You know what'll happen.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I know... After the fifth day, the zap apples disappear...

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Look! The third sign! Right on time! Hot diggity!

speaker: Granny Smith
Big McIntosh
Applejack
Apple Bloom
text: Wow!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Alright, you lazy daisies, move your caboose!

speaker: Applejack
text: I'm sorry, Apple Bloom, but don't you fret. Granny Smith's got no shortage of entertainin' stories to tell.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I know. That's what I'm worried about.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I'll be embarrassed, shamed, disgraced, mortified, humiliate–

speaker: Scootaloo
text: What are you, a dictionary?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Snap out of it. We're here to help you!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: After all, we are the Cutie Mark Crusaders. We'll figure out a way to postpone your presentation.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: But how? Ugh! All this worry is makin' me sick!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Sick?

speaker: Scootaloo
text: That's it! C'mon!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Ten-hut! Now listen here, troops! Now, I don't want any whinin' or cryin' or crackin' under pressure! Do I make myself clear!?

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Court-martialed!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Stay still, Apple Bloom! You have to look sick!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Aaah! [muffled] Hey, this is hot!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: What in the hayseed is going on in there, silly billy?

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Oh, Granny Smith! We were just about to come get you!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Apple Bloom's sick! Looks like she might have to stay home all week!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: [mumbles] Ooh! Perfect as a Piccadilly pear!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Now what?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: It's already almost sundown! Tomorrow is Sunday, and I only have one more day to figure something out!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Hey! Look!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: That's the fourth sign!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: The zap apples have appeared!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: And that gives me an idea!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: We can't move Family Appreciation Day, so let's move harvest day instead!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: They don't look... quite ripe.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Harvesting apples early never hurt an apple.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I don't know... Zap apple trees aren't like normal apple trees. They're magic.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: How different can they be?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Well if we can't buck 'em, let's just pick 'em!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Any *other* bright ideas?

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Granny Smith, it's Miss Cheerilee! Apple Bloom said you wanted to speak with me?... Hello? Granny Smi–

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [mimicking Granny Smith] Well hello there! Howdydoo!

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Hi... uh... Granny Smith... is, ugh, everything okay?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [mimicking Granny Smith] Of course it is! Why wouldn't it be?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [mimicking Granny Smith] Oh, er, excuse me. Uh, pickles always give me the hiccups! I need to tell you that I can't make the presentation on Monday after all!

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Oh no, is that so?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [mimicking Granny Smith] No doubts about it! I gotta shear the flowers and water the sheep! I mean, I have to water the flowers and shear the sheep!

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Oh, well, that's too bad. We can reschedule.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: E- whut- hai- where am I? Well, howdy, Miss Cheerilee! You window shopping?

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Uh... no? You asked me to come here to tell me that you wouldn't be making it to Family Appreciation Day?

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Fiddlesticks! I wouldn't miss it for all the tea in Canterlot!

speaker: Cheerilee
text: But- didn't you just say...?

speaker: Granny Smith
text: See you Monday!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [sighs] I can't believe she woke up from her nap. She *never* wakes up from her nap! [muffled] I wish I could just run off and hide!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Well, *you* can't run off... but maybe somepony else can!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Yee-haw!

speaker: Applejack
text: The zap apple harvest has begun!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: And tomorrow we will be makin' up some zap apple jam!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: [in deeper voice] Miss Granny Smith? Telegram.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Well, bust my buttons. Uncle Apple Strudel wants me to pay him a visit.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: And you can just make the 8AM train. I already packed you a bag!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Well, that was considerate.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: But don't you worry, flibbertigibbet! I'll be back in time to make that jam!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [sighs] That train ride takes all day. I'm safe. Hah.

speaker: Cheerilee
text: For today's Family Appreciation Day, we are pleased to welcome Granny Smith. Um... Apple Bloom? Is Granny Smith here?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Oh, I'm sorry, Miss Cheerilee, but she got called out of town on account of a family emergency–

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Well, howdy, my little ponies!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Howdy, y'all! I'm as happy as a pig in a fresh mudpile to be here!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Whuh- what are you doing here? Did you miss the train?

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Er, no, it came. And Uncle Apple Strudel was on it.

speaker: Apple Strudel
text: Ooooooh, noogie-noogie-noggie! [laughs madly]

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: I can't wait to hear Granny Smith's presentation. [hushed] If she can remember any of it.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Long ago, when I was a little pony, things were very different here in Ponyville, 'cause there was *no Ponyville*!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: [voiceover] That's right, my little ponies. Me and my family were pilgrim pony folk, back when I was a little filly. Oh, we ventured far and wide, collecting new seeds and sellin' the old. But my pa was the finest seed collector in all of Equestria. Then, one day, the Smith family found themselves in the most brilliant, most grand, most magnificent of all cities. A place called... Canterlot. Well, I bet your hooves to hindquarters I had never seen anything like it before nor since. And as if the beauty of that city wasn't enough, suddenly, *she* appeared. Princess Celestia, the most regal of all ponies. When lo and behold, she stopped to look at my pa's seed collection. Then Princess Celestia saw that we were plumb-tuckered and hankerin' to find our forever home. And bein' a royal Princess and all, she knew exactly the place for us to lay down our stakes. My pa gave the Princess a mighty thanks. We quickly found that land near the Everfree Forest, and we built our first home. Next, we planted our first orchards. But an orchard don't grow overnight, and we were getting mighty short on food. Now mind you, we were cautioned about the forest, and we knew that it was not fit to enter.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: [voiceover] But I knew there was critters livin' there. There must be somethin' to eat. It was dark and musty, and I won't lie, it was scary. But every inch was covered in plant life, and before I knew it, wasn't I standin' in front of the most incredible apple trees! I had never seen anything that bore this kind of colorful fruit! Oh I started picking apples quick as a whip!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: [voiceover] I turned, and there before me stood the timberwolves! I've never run so fast in my life. I did the only thing I could think of.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: [voiceover] My pa and I planted those special apple seeds, and before our eyes they grew like wildfire. Why, we had full grown trees faster than you could say 'lickety split'. Then each year, I paid close attention to the signs of the zap apples' special harvesting times. How the weather affects the Everfree Forest, how the timberwolves howl when the zap apples first start growing, and how they zapped away if you didn't pick 'em all in one day! And the fruits of our labor were the best fruit we ever tasted. Soon enough I was mixing up batches of zap apple jam. Just like harvestin' the zap apples had its special rules, so did makin' zap apple jam. I learned that you gotta be extra friendly with the bees, otherwise their honey won't taste rightly sweet to mix in with the zap apples. Who'd'a thought that glass jars needed talkin' to? Or that zap apples like pink polka dots? But magic is as magic does. Just funny that way. Then ponies started comin' to our farm from far and wide just to get a taste of my zap apple jam. Some of them decided to stay, like Stinkin' Rich, Diamond Tiara's great grandfather. Matter of fact, the first thing he ever sold was my zap apple jam.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: [voiceover] And before we knew it, we had ourselves a nice little town, bustling with all kinds of ponies. And that is how Ponyville was founded.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Oh, thank you kindly, little ponies. Oh, now now, let's settle down.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: So if it weren't for you and the zap apples, Ponyville wouldn't even exist?!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Darn tootin', little filly!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: If it weren't for my Granny Smith, your daddy wouldn't have Barnyard Bargains.

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: But–

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: But she's just a... kooky old lady!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: She is not a kooky old lady! She is the most amazing pony in all of Ponyville!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: I think this is the best zap apple jam I've tasted yet!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Must be 'cause *you* had something to do with it, Apple Bloom.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: You betcha. Apple Bloom is one humdinger of a zap apple jammer!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I am?

speaker: Applejack
text: So I take it Family Appreciation Day went well?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Did it? *My Granny Smith is super special! I just forgot that for a little while.*

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Aw, don't fret. I forget things all the time. Now, I'll getcha... er... somethin'. Aw.

speaker: Applejack
text: Who wants to help Granny sing to the water?

speaker: Foals
text: We do, we do!

speaker: Granny Smith
Foals
text: A, B, C, D, E, F, G... [continues]

speaker: Filthy Rich
text: Diamond Tiara?

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: But dad!

speaker: Applejack
text: Can you believe the new baby is finally here?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Cup Cake and Carrot Cake must be so proud!

speaker: Rarity
text: I wonder if it's a filly or a colt?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I wanna see the new baby pony! I wanna see! Which one is it?!

speaker: Mr Cake
text: Meet our son, Pound Cake.

speaker: Fluttershy
Rainbow Dash
Pinkie Pie
Applejack
Rarity
Twilight Sparkle
text: Awwww.

speaker: Mr Cake
text: ...*and* our daughter, Pumpkin Cake.

speaker: Fluttershy
Rainbow Dash
Pinkie Pie
Applejack
Rarity
Twilight Sparkle
text: Huh?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Two new foals for me to play with? [gasps] That's two, two, two times the fun! *This is the greatest day ever*! We need to celebrate your birthday, babies, 'cause you were just born today! Woo-hoo!

speaker: Nurse Redheart
text: Shhh. The babies are trying to sleep.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: But I was just–

speaker: Nurse Redheart
text: Shhh.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: But–

speaker: Nurse Redheart
text: Shhh!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [quieter] Happy happy birthday to you and you today–

speaker: Applejack
text: Now how in thunderation is one of them twins a Pegasus and the other one a unicorn?

speaker: Mr Cake
text: Easy. My great-great-great-great grandfather was a unicorn, and Cup Cake's great aunt's second cousin twice removed was a Pegasus. That makes sense, right?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Aw, yeah! Heh, just you wait! Once little Pound Cake there gets his wings going, he'll be all over the place.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: And be careful around Pumpkin Cake.

speaker: Rarity
text: Baby unicorns get strange magic surges that come and go.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Quick! Make a wish and blow out your candles! Which is easy, 'cause there are zero candles! You are zero years old, after all!

speaker: Nurse Redheart
text: Shhh!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text:
Happy month-i-versary to you and you today!
*[very quickly]* I-can't-believe-you're-already-a-month-old. Time-sure-flies-doesn't-it-wow. Seems-like-only yesterday-you-were-born.
But now you're a month old today, hey!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Are you ready for your favoritest game in the whole wide world? Where's Pinkie Pie...? *Here I am*! Where's Pinkie Pie...? *Here I am*! Where's Pinkie Pie...? *Here I am*!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Here I am! Here I am! Here I am! [blows raspberry]

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: Everything okay in there? Who needs a diaper change?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Don't worry, they're fine! [sniffs] Oogh, I mean...

speaker: Mr Cake
text: Oh, I got it.

speaker: Mr Cake
text: Is anypony hungry?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ah, no thanks. I just had a big breakfast.

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: I'm on it.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh, oh, you're making funny faces! I have one! Bleghhh!

speaker: Mr Cake
text: [chuckles] No, y'see, Pinkie, the babies need to be burped.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: All set now? Everything good? Okay, who wants to play again?

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: Uh uh uh, Pound Cake, no pounding things.

speaker: Mr Cake
text: Uh uh uh uh, we don't chew on things, Pumpkin Cake.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Except food.

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: [gasps] Food! Great cinnamon sticks, I completely forgot.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: No, you just fed them bottles, remember?

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: Not the babies' food!

speaker: Mr Cake
text: Gh! The food for the enormously big catering order we have to deliver today!

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: Oh, with the new twins, we've been so distracted!

speaker: Mr Cake
text: Gh, quick, honeybun, we need to find a babysitter to watch the foals while we take care of this.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I could do it! I wanna do it! Oh, the babies love playing with me, I'll do it!

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: I wonder who would be available on such short notice.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Me! Me! Pick me!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Oh, I would love to babysit! But I can't today, sorry. I promised Angel we'd go on a picnic. You understand, don't you? Y-you're not mad at me, are you? *Please don't be mad at me*!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I'll do it! Pick me!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I have to finish this report for the Princess summarizing all my *other* reports to the Princess.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I wanna babysit! Pick me!

speaker: Applejack
text: Babysit? Now? When there's a swarm o' hungry caterpillars headin' this way? I gotta get all these apples picked before they get swarmed on!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ooh, ooh, I wanna do it!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I got tickets to the Wonderbolts airshow this afternoon. Gotta dash!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ask me! Mememememememememememememe!

speaker: Rarity
text: *Moi?* Babysit? N- Oh nonononononononono! I'm flattered that you would think about me though.

speaker: Mr Cake
text: [groans] [unenthusiastically] Pinkie Pie, how would you like to babysit for us?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [gasps] I dunno. I'll have to check my schedule.

speaker: Mr Cake
text: Now, Pinkie, are you sure you really understand the responsibility of watching over two babies?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I can be responsible. Why, responsibility is my middle name. Pinkie Responsibility Pie.

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: But this time you need to *take care of them*, not just play with them. You have to be responsible.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yes, I know. I will. I am.

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: Oh, here you are, dearie. All your responsibilities are on this list.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Whoa! That's a lot of responsi– Consider it done.

speaker: Mr Cake
text: [to Mrs. Cake] We'll frost it when we get there! C'mon, sugarplum, tick-tick!

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: Take good care of our two precious little ginger snaps!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: No problemo, Mr. and Mrs. Cake. Everything is under control.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Uh-oh.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh, don't cry, little friends! Look, look! Where's Pinkie Pie...? Where's Pinkie Pie?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh no... I'm right here, see?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh, think think think... Aha!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Hey guys, watch this!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Hey, you're a wonderful crowd here tonight! Where y'all from? Wow, that's great. Y'know, I used to have an ant farm, but I had to get rid of it because... I couldn't find tractors that small!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Get it? Tractors that small? [pause] The other day, I spilled spot remover on my dog... and now I can't find him!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Gee, tough crowd. [to herself] Tell me about it. Fine, I wasn't gonna pull off a show stopper, but you're a lovely audience and I think you deserve it!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text:
First you jiggle your tail! Oink oink oink!
Then you wriggle your snout! Oink oink oink!
Then you wiggle your rump! Oink oink oink!
Then shout it out! Oink oink oink!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text:
First you jiggle your tail! Oink oink oink!
Then you wriggle your snout! Oink oink oink!
Then you wiggle your rump! Oink oink oink!
Then shout it out! Oink oink oink!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text:
First you jiggle your tail! Oink oink oink!
Then you wriggle your snout! Oink oink oink!
Then you wiggle your rump! Oink oink oink!
Then shout it out! Oink oink oink!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: There, see? Nothing to this babysitting business! Ugh!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Snack time. That's easy enough. Okie-dokie! Eat up! Like this! Num-num-num, num-num-num-num! Ahh!

speaker: Pumpkin Cake
text: Nom-

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: No, Pumpkin Cake, we eat food, not tablecloths.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Huh, huh? Uh, hey, guys, look at me!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Achoo!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yeah. I think I can see where this is going. [snorts]

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Towels are not food, Pumpkin Cake!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Drop it... Drop it... Drop it!?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ooh, look, guys! Bubbles! [blows]

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Uh, uh, uh, uh, don't cry! Look, look, uh, floating things! Ooh, aaah, eeh!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Uh, don't make me do it, guys! You know what happens when you mix flour and water, don't you?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [sniffs] [gasps] [hoof on nose] Smells like somepony needs me to changy-wangy their diaper-wiper right now-a-wow! [tiptoeing noise] Easy... easy...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Wait- no- stay there- just- for a second- stand still, I've almost-

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh, you've gotta be kidding me.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh! Thank goodness they're home!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Hi! I finished up the work I had to do, so I thought I'd stop by and see if you needed any help. Whoa!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Thank you, thank you, thank you for coming! I can't begin to tell you what my day has been like! I mean, these babies just won't listen to reason, and don't even get me started on their taste in stand-up comedy.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: It's okay, Pinkie. I figured you would need some help. That's why I stopped by.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ex-*cuse* me?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Babies take a lot of work, and some ponies are just not cut out to handle the responsibility.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Is that so? Well, thanks for stopping by, Twilight. Sorry, I don't have time to visit. I'm very very busy with my *responsibilities* here.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I'm happy to help! It's no trouble–

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Well, of all the– She thinks I can't handle things on my own! Maybe because I haven't handled things on my own. Well, I *can* handle things on my own!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Pound Cake. [growls] This is a crib. It is only to be used for napping, sleeping, and on occasion with permission, as a pretend old-timey Western fort. It is *not* a trampoline, so stop your jumping right now, mister!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: And you, young filly. We do not put anything in our mouth that we cannot safely and properly digest, so stop slobbering on that toy this instant!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Now, we've all had a very exhausting afternoon, and it's time for all good little foals to take their nap. So, *fall asleep*!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [sighs] [kisses twice] Sleep tight.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Now that's what I call handling things. [gasps]

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh, nononono. Not good, not good, not good! Pound? Pumpkin? Where are you? Come out, come out, wherever you are!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Whoa! You be a good little girl now, Pumpkin-wumpkin, and stay in your crib for your pal Pinkie-winkie!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Pound Cake? [clicks] Here, Pound Cake!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Uh, Pound Cake? Uh...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [squeals] You can fly?!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh... get down here... this instant... young... colt! [gasps for breath] I'm responsible for you!

speaker: Pumpkin Cake
text: [giggles] Nom nom nom.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: No no no, Pumpkin.

speaker: Pumpkin Cake
text: Nom nom.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: No no.

speaker: Pumpkin Cake
text: Nom.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: No. Hmph! I am the responsible one, and I said no.

speaker: Pound Cake
text: Wheeee!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: That goes for you too, Pound Cake!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Gotcha! I *think?* [yelping]

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Mm, razzleberry. I'm- not- letting- go! I'm- re-spon-si-ble!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh, not you too! There! *Now* who's the responsible one?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [giggles] Y'know, you're right. That *is* funny.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: *Dear Princess Celestia,*

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: *I've always had fun playing with little kids, and I thought babysitting meant just more playtime, right? Wrong! Being a caregiver is way more responsibility than just being a playmate. And today, I learned that sometimes our desire for responsibility can outrun our actual ability to handle it.*

speaker: Mr Cake
text: Pinkie Pie! We're back!

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: How did everything go? [gasps]

speaker: Mr Cake
text: Are we in the right place?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Shhh!

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: P-Pinkie. This is just... just...

speaker: Mr Cake
text: Amazing is what it is. We had no idea how responsible you really are. Would you be interested in becoming our go-to babysitter on a permanent basis?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [gasps] Hm- Ah- lemme check my schedule! I should be available a week from... never!

speaker: Pound Cake
text: Pinkie...

speaker: Pumpkin Cake
text: Pie...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [happily gasps] I have some free time next Tuesday.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Whoo-- Whoa! Whoo-hoo! Applejack, you're sure to knock everypony's hat off at the Equestria Rodeo competition!

speaker: Applejack
text: Aw shucks, Apple Bloom. I sure hope so.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Hope so? I know so! After all, you're the ten-time rodeo champion of Ponyville! Why, you've got more blue ribbons than anypony in Ponyville *ever*! And I can't wait for my big sis to win every blue ribbon in Equestria and bring home the title of Equestria Rodeo champion!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Huh? Now, careful, Derpy! Don't want to do any more damage than you've already done.

speaker: Derpy
text: I just don't know what went wrong.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Yeah. It's a mystery.

speaker: Derpy
text: Nice work, Rainbow Dash.

speaker: Derpy
text: You okay, Rainbow Dash? Anything I can do to help?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: No! Nothing! In the name of Celestia, just sit there and do nothing!

speaker: Derpy
text: Oops. My bad.

speaker: Crowd
text: Applejack! Applejack! Applejack! Applejack! [continue chanting under]

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: Everypony, can I get your attention? Attention please!

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: Yes, we are all here to send Applejack to compete in this year's Equestria Rodeo competition in Canterlot.

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: And I want to thank Applejack in advance for generously offering up her prize money to fix town hall.

speaker: Derpy
text: Yeah, Applejack! Whoo-hoo!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Speech! Speech!

speaker: Applejack
text: Oh, shucks. I'm not much for speeches.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Alright then, no speech!

speaker: Applejack
text: Buuut! This here is the nicest send off anypony could ask for. Y'all have been cheering me on in every rodeo since I was a *little* little pony. So it seems only fittin' to use my winnings to fix up town hall. I promise to make Ponyville proud.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: I want you to show all them highfalutin rodeo ponies what a *real* rodeo pony's like!

speaker: Applejack
text: You betcha, Granny Smith.

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: And bring back all that money!

speaker: Applejack
text: You betcha, Mayor.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: And have fun. And don't be nervous. Or if you are, use that nervous energy to do even better than you already would! And eat peanuts and popcorn and taffy and taffy gives lots of nervous energy! [munching]

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Just do your best, Applejack.

speaker: Applejack
text: I'll do better than my best!

speaker: Conductor
text: The train to Canterlot is about to leave! All aboard who's coming aboard!

speaker: Applejack
text: Guess that means me.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Seeya in a week!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: With lots of new blue ribbons!

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: And lots of money!

speaker: Applejack
text: Darn tootin'! See y'all in a week, with a big bag full of blue ribbons!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: And drink sarsaparilla! What? It gives you extra sass.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Oh, I hope Applejack is surprised by this surprise party!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Well, that *is* the point.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I know, but I hope she isn't *so* surprised she's startled, because while being surprised can be nice, being startled can be... very startling.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Surprise!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: [gasps] Oh, Pinkie, you startled me.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Sorry! I was just practicing my "surprise!" for when we surprise Applejack with this super cool party for becoming rodeo champion of Equestria! *Surprise*!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Quiet, Pinkie, I think Applejack's coming!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Don't worry, Twilight. Got my lips all limbered up! [makes various noises with her mouth]

speaker: Ponies
text: Surprise!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Surprise! Shoot!

speaker: Parcel Post
text: Wow, this is the best surprise ever! How did you know it was my birthday?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Who's it from, Twilight? What's it say?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: It's from Applejack. "*Family and friends, not coming back to Ponyville.*"

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: "*...Don't worry, will send money soon.*" That's all there is.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Applejack's... not comin' back?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: What do you mean Applejack's not coming back?! She loves Ponyville!

speaker: Granny Smith
text: And she loves Sweet Apple Acres!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: And she loves her family!

speaker: Rarity
text: [gasps] Something just dreadful must have happened to Applejack to make her not return!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Maybe she's hurt, or sad, or scared!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: So, what are we waiting for? Let's go find her!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Don't worry. We'll search all of Equestria if we have to. We'll bring her back.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Y'all are the best.

speaker: Granny Smith
text: Thank you, girls! [to Big McIntosh] Our little bushel just lost one apple.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I hope this lead doesn't turn out to be a dead end. I don't wanna go home empty-hooved after promising we'd find her.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I don't know how we'll break it to the Apple family.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I don't know how we'll break it to Ponyville!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I don't know how I'll make it to the next stop!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: This is Dodge Junction, girls. Applejack is supposed to have come here after the rodeo ended. Let's fan out and try to find her.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ooh, pickles! [knocking] Hurryhurryhurryhurryhurry! Hurry it up in there!

speaker: Applejack
text: Huh, some ponies. Sheesh.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Applejack! I found her, I found her, I found her, I found her, I found her!

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, Applejack, thank heavens!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: We're so glad you're safe!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I found her, I found her, I found her, I found her! Be right back.

speaker: Applejack
text: Uh, hey, everypony. What's up?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Why didn't you come back to Ponyville?!

speaker: Rarity
text: Yes, why are you here?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Are you okay?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Do you have any snacks?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Tell us what happened, Applejack!

speaker: Cherry Jubilee
text: Applejack? Are these some of your Ponyville friends?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Yes, ma'am.

speaker: Rarity
text: And you are?

speaker: Cherry Jubilee
text: Why, I'm Cherry Jubilee, boss of Cherry Hill Ranch. Hasn't Applejack told ya? I saw her compete at the Equestria Rodeo. Never saw anypony win so many ribbons in all my life.

speaker: Applejack
text: Aw shucks, Miss Jubilee. You don't have to go into all that.

speaker: Cherry Jubilee
text: Oh, she's so modest. Anyway, I can always use a pony with quick hooves and a strong back. So, when I heard Applejack was looking for a change of scenery, I snapped her up as quick as I could and brought her to Dodge Junction. Well, I'll let you catch up with your friends. See you back at the ranch.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: "*Change of scenery*"? What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: Applejack
text: S'no big deal, guys. I thought cherries would be a nice change from apples, so I took the job and came here. That's it. End of story.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: That's it? Well, that's a terrible story!

speaker: Applejack
text: Sorry, but that's all there is to tell. Thanks for checkin' on me, but y'all can go home now. Tell my family hi, and that I'm doing a-okay.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Excuse me, AJ, but we didn't travel *all over Equestria* searching for you to come home without you!

speaker: Applejack
text: Well, I didn't ask you to come lookin' for me! There is nothin' to tell and I am *not* going back to Ponyville!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I don't care what she says. Applejack's not telling us something.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Twilight's right. We gotta get her to spill the beans.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: *What*?! She had beans? Ugh, I told her I was snacky!

speaker: Cherry Jubilee
text: You ready to put your back into it, Applejack?

speaker: Applejack
text: Sure am, Miss Jubilee.

speaker: Cherry Jubilee
text: Terr-ific. Come on in, girls!

speaker: Applejack
text: What are you all doing here?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: We're your cherry sorters. Shall we get started?

speaker: Applejack
text: Fine.

speaker: Cherry Jubilee
text: Haha, red cherries go in one bin, and yellow cherries go in the other. Simple as cherry pie. Uh, just one teensy thing to remember – have fun!

speaker: Applejack
text: What are you five up to?

speaker: Rarity
text: Well, uh, you made working on a cherry orchard sound... so delightful.

speaker: Applejack
text: Uh-huh. Well, just remember: No talking about Ponyville.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Fine! Why don't you quit talking and get walking?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: So, AJ, how was Canterlot? Not talking about Ponyville, talking about Canterlot, totally different town.

speaker: Applejack
text: Canterlot was fine.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Was the rodeo fun?

speaker: Applejack
text: Yes.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Did you meet some nice ponies there?

speaker: Applejack
text: Some.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Really? Did you see Wild Bull Hickok? What about Calamity Mane?

speaker: Applejack
text: Yes, I saw 'em both.

speaker: Rarity
text: And how did you meet Miss Jubilee?

speaker: Applejack
text: Um, well, Miss Jubilee had a cherry stand at the rodeo. Real good treats.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Um, excuse me?

speaker: Applejack
text: Cherry winks, cherry cheesecake, cherry tarts. We struck up a conversation, being orchard folk and all.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: So you told her about Sweet Apple Acres?

speaker: Applejack
text: Yes.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Did you tell *her* why you weren't going back?

speaker: Applejack
text: No, 'cuz it was none of *her* business!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Ooh... Can you *please* slow down?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Is it because I made it rain on you that *one time*?

speaker: Applejack
text: No!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Help!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Is it because you were insulted when I gave you that book on organized orchards?

speaker: Applejack
text: NO!

speaker: Rarity
text: Is it because you were insulted when I insulted your hair?

speaker: Applejack
text: No, no, NO! I'm not telling you why, so just–

speaker: Fluttershy
text: *STOP*!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Well, girls, we seem to be striking out.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: That's 'cause we're playing too nice.

speaker: Rarity
text: Yes. Desperate times do call for desperate measures.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: It's time to call in the big guns.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Hey, Applejack. Need some help?

speaker: Applejack
text: You promise not to ask me any questions?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I promise.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Have you ever had a cherrychanga? Ooh! Sorry, that was a question.

speaker: Applejack
text: That kind of question is fine, Pinkie. No, I-I never had a cherrychanga.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Well, no wonder, because I made it up myself! A cherrychanga is mashed up cherries in a tortilla that's deep fried. Cherrychanga. Great name, huh? Oh, but maybe I should call it a chimicherry. Ooh, that's good too. Which do you think sounds better? Cherrychanga or chimicherry? Or what if I combine them? Chimicherrychanga! What sounds the funniest? I like funny words! One of my favorite funny words is 'kumquat'! I didn't make that one up. I would work in a kumquat orchard just so I could say 'kumquat' all day! Kumquat, kumquat, kumquat! And 'pickle barrel'! Isn't that just the funnest thing to say? Pickle barrel, pickle barrel, pickle barrel! Say it with me! Pickle barrel, kumquat, pickle barrel, kumquat, pickle barrel, kumquat, chimicherrychanga!

speaker: Applejack
text: *No*! Make it stop, make it stop!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: The only way to make it stop is for you to spill the beans!

speaker: Applejack
text: Never!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Speaking of beans, did you ever realize how many words rhyme with 'beans'? Lean, mean, spleen, unclean, bean... [continues under]

speaker: Applejack
text: Alright, alright! I'll tell everypony what's goin' on! Just *please* stop talkin'! But... can it wait 'til tomorrow at breakfast? I'm plum tuckered out.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Tomorrow, huh? I don't know...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Do you Pinkie promise?

speaker: Applejack
text: [sighs] I will tell you the whole truth at breakfast. Pinkie promise.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I'm glad we're finally gonna get some answers from Applejack.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Yeah, maybe.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Don't worry, Rainbow. She's gotta 'fess up after making a Pinkie promise.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Good morning, Applejack. You ready for br– [gasps]

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: *Nopony breaks a Pinkie promise*!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: *Applejack*! [slightly distorted] *You Pinkie promised*!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Applejack, come back here!

speaker: Applejack
text: Giddy up, fellas, I gotta get the heck out of Dodge!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: She's gonna get away!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh no, she won't! Look, girls!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Follow that stagecoach! Oh, we have you now!

speaker: Applejack
text: Whoa! What the hay?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Pull over!

speaker: Applejack
text: Hey! Cut that out! Whoa! [to coach ponies] I'll pay you double to outrun them.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: We'll pay you triple to slow down!

speaker: Applejack
text: I'll pay you quadruple to leave them in the dust!

speaker: Rarity
text: That was rude!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Get them! *Get them*!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Come on, Fluttershy!

speaker: Applejack
text: Hyah! C'mon, y'all! Go, go!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Applejack, you broke your Pinkie promise! Apologize!

speaker: Applejack
text: Pinkie, I did not break my promise!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Wha?

speaker: Applejack
text: If y'all reckon back, I told you that I would tell you everything *at breakfast*. But I didn't come for breakfast. I couldn't come to that breakfast, not if it meant telling y'all what happened.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Well, I... I...

speaker: Applejack
text: I'm sorry, Pinkie, but I can't tell y'all the truth. I just can't!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Well I heard a "sorry" in there, so that'll have to do for now. I'll get a real apology later. Rarity, catch me.

speaker: Rarity
text: What? Pinkie– [screams]

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Rainbow, go back!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: No time! They knew what they were getting into!

speaker: Applejack
text: Yes. Hyah!

speaker: Applejack
text: Yee-haw!

speaker: Coach ponies
text: [in unison] Lady, you're trouble.

speaker: Applejack
text: Ha, try and catch me now. Oh, nuts.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Not so fast!

speaker: Applejack
text: Fine. Now you know.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Know what?

speaker: Applejack
text: Well, just look!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I am. You won an amazing number of ribbons, just like Miss Jubilee said!

speaker: Applejack
text: Don't you get it? There's every color of ribbon down there. Every color... but... blue. I came in fourth, third, even second, but I didn't win *one* first prize, and I certainly didn't win any prize money.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: But the telegram said you were gonna *send* money.

speaker: Applejack
text: That's why I came here. I wanted to *earn* some money. After that big old send off Ponyville gave me, I just didn't have the nerve to come home empty-hooved. I couldn't come home a failure.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Applejack, you're not a failure.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: And we're your friends! We don't care if you came in fiftieth place! You're still number one in our books.

speaker: Applejack
text: So... you're not upset or disappointed?

speaker: Fluttershy
Rainbow Dash
Twilight Sparkle
text: Nn-nn.

speaker: Applejack
text: But what about the mayor? I don't think I can face her and tell her I didn't get that money to fix the broken roof.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Applejack, we can always find a way to fix that hole in the roof. But if you don't come back, we'll never be able to fix the hole in our hearts.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [sniffles] Darn it! Now you got me acting all sappy!

speaker: Applejack
text: *Dear Princess Celestia,*

speaker: Applejack
text: *It's a tad easier to be proud when you come in first than it is when you finish further back. But there's no reason to hide when you don't do as well as you'd hoped. You can't run away from your problems. Better to run*to*your friends and family.*

speaker: Pinkie Pie

I couldn't sleep last night 'cause I was so excited about cider season, and I had this brilliant idea to come down here and camp out, so I told a few others about it, and they all thought it was a great idea too, and now it's just a big old cider party! Woo-hoo! Oh, gosh, that's a lot of ponies. Hope they don't run out before you get any.

speaker: Applejack
text: *I wanted to share my thoughts with you.*[clears throat]*I didn't learn anythin'! Ha! I was right all along! If you take your time to do things the right way, your work will speak for itself. Sure I could tell you I learned something about how my friends are always there to help me, and I can count on them no matter what, but truth is, I knew that already too.*

text: Hey, Rarity. Hey, Pinkie Pie. What are you looking at?

text: Rainbow Dash! Isn't she the most daring devil? I mean, the most devilish darer? I mean—

Pinkie Pie

text: Well, that all depends on your recovery, but I'd say a few days minimum.

text: Ooh, just like a spider! [to Doctor Horse] Did the crash somehow give her super-duper spider powers?

text: Nnnno, nor did it give her amazing healing powers. She needs to stay in bed for a few days.

text: It's not so bad, Rainbow Dash.

speaker: Pinkie Pie

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: What's this? 'Daring Do and the Quest for the Sapphire Stone'.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: This is the first story in the series. I own all of them. [squee]

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: No thanks. I *so* don't read. I'm a world-class athlete. Reading's for eggheads like you, Twilight. Heh, no offense, but I am *not* reading. It's undeniably, unquestionably, uncool.

speaker: Applejack
text: Is she serious? Who doesn't like to read a bang-up tale from time to time?

speaker: Rarity
text: Why, a good book is almost as magnificent as silk pajamas on a Sunday morning, heh!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Reading is for everypony, Rainbow Dash!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yeah! I love reading, and my head isn't even close to the shape of an egg! It's more the shape of an apple, or maybe an orange, but a *big* orange! More like a grapefruit really...

speaker: Nurse Sweetheart
text: All right, my little ponies. Rainbow Dash needs her rest. You'll have to come back tomorrow.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I think you'd like Daring. She's a lot like you. Adventurous, fierce, and undeniably, unquestionably, unstoppable.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: ...to get to the other side! Get it? Never mind...

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [sighs] [unenthusiastically] "As Daring Do trekked through the tropical jungle, the wet heat sapped her energy and slowed her every step. If only she could escape this oppressive atmosphere and fly up into the cool blue sky. But her crash landing in the jungle had injured her wing and she was grounded for a few days. Few days... it might as well be a few months, or a few years!" Huh. I'm right there with you, sister.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [voiceover] "The mosquitoes buzzed loudly. The macaws cried from the high trees. Yet all of these distracting noises were not enough to cover the sound of the predators following her every step."

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [voiceover, steadily getting more excited] "Safely landing on the other side, Daring finally allowed herself a moment to breathe. She turned around to find herself face to face with the long lost temple that she had sought tirelessly for over sixty days and nights!"

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I hate to admit it to myself, and would *really* hate to admit it to my friends, but... *I love this story*! I, I... I love reading! I'm an egghead.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [voiceover] "The smell of decay and danger hit Daring Do as she peered into the dimly-lit entrance of the ancient temple."

text: Phew!

text: You win some, you lose some.

text: But you *don't* lose some. I don't think you've ever lost a game of—

text: [yawns] Thanks for coming!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: But yesterday you were desperate for things to do!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Do? Who said anything about Daring Do? I told you I'm not interested in reading. [yawns] It's nap time for me! [mocks snoring]

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Glad we could... cheer you up?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Alright then.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: "Daring Do stood at the entrance to the central temple chamber."

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [voiceover] "At last, she was face-to-face with the legendary sapphire statue!"

speaker: Daring Do
text: Hmm, there must be a pattern here. What do all these animals have in common? Ah-ha! These animals are all predators... except... rats! Phew!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Hello, Rainbow Dash!

speaker: Rarity
text: How's our patient doing today?

speaker: Applejack
text: Ugh, we need to get some fresh air in here. You're lookin' sweatier than a pig wrangler on a summer's day.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Uh, well, guys, thanks for visiting, but—

speaker: Nurse Snowheart
text: Okay, now, dinner time for Rainbow Dash.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Oh, just in time. I am sooo hungry.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, well, don't mind us, Rainbow Dash.

speaker: Applejack
text: Yeah, just go ahead and eat up.

speaker: Rarity
text: Uh, on second thought—

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Uh, we'll see you tomorrow, Rainbow Dash, aheh...

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [spits] "'You thought you could evade me and capture the relic for yourself, but you are sadly mistaken, Miss Do.'"

speaker: Ahuizotl
text: And now, you shall meet your doom! [whistles]

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Whoa! Who is this dude?

text: [pants] You won't get away with this, Ahuizotl!

speaker: Daring Do
text: [exasperated sigh] Not again...

speaker: Daring Do
text: Quicksand! [sounds of exertion]

text: [echoing] Rainbow Dash?

speaker: Doctor Horse
text: [muffled] Rainbow Dash? [normal] Rainbow Da-ash!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: H— oh, good evening—

speaker: Doctor Horse
text: Morning.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: —morning. Doc.

speaker: Doctor Horse
text: Have you been up all night?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Uh, of course not. [blows]

speaker: Doctor Horse
text: Well, I'll be quick. Congratulations, Rainbow Dash, we're checking you out of the hospital.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: What? Later today? [biting hoof]

text: No. Right now!

speaker: Doctor Horse
text: 'Right now' right now.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: But I don't feel better!

speaker: Doctor Horse
text: Now take it easy, Rainbow Dash. Remember to stay off that wing for a week.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: How will I ever find out what happens to Daring Do?!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Is Ahuizotl going to get away with the statuette? What's gonna happen to Daring?! Ah-ha! Twilight has a copy of the book! Uh, but I can't ask her after I called her an egghead and all...

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Ugh, this is making me sick all over again!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Owww... [grunts in pain unrealistically] Oh, the pain... the pain!

text: Rainbow Dash! What are you doing here, a-anything wrong?

speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: I was touching your good wing.

speaker: Rainbow Dash

speaker: Doctor Horse
text: [chuckles] I think I know what the trouble is. A severe case of lazy-itis.

text: Move away!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: He'll get to her! He's too strong!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Let him go!

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Shmoopy-doo– Whoa!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: [sigh] I sure am glad you found those shovels.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: One more minute and the spell will be broken!

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: *Shmoopy-doo!*

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Sweetums?!

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: *Shmoopy-doo!*

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: *Aaaa*–

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Oh, please be normal, please be normal.

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Am I wearing a wedding veil?

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Eeyup.

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Are you sitting on a feather bed in a hole in the ground?

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Eeyup.

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Girls! Can you explain why I look like I'm getting married at the bottom of a pit?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: We may have given you the teeny-tiniest bit of love potion... that may have turned out to actually be a love *poison*, and you may have gone just a *teeny*-tiniest bit nutty.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: But we only did it because we thought you and Big Mac would be really happy if you could be each others very special someponies on Hearts and Hooves Day.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Our hearts and hooves were in the right place.

speaker: Cheerilee
text: We appreciate that you care about us and want us to be happy but–

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: *But no matter how good our intentions might have been, we shoulda never meddled in your relationship.*

speaker: Scootaloo
text: *Nopony can force two ponies to be together.*

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: *It's up to everypony to choose that very special somepony for themselves.*

speaker: Sweetie Belle
Apple Bloom
Scootaloo
text: We're sorry.

speaker: Cheerilee
text: And you can think about how sorry you are while you're doing *all* of Big Mac's chores at Sweet Apple Acres. Does that seem like a fair punishment to you?

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Eeyup.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Hey there, Miss Cheerilee! What are you doin' here?

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Since you three are doing all of his chores, Big Mac and I thought we'd have a picnic at the gazebo. Ready, *sugar bear*?

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Eeyup, *pumpkin pie*.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
Apple Bloom
Scootaloo
text: [gasp] *NOOOOO!!!*

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Let's do this!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [wibbles tongue] Happy! Sad. Happy! Sad. Happy! Sad. Open, shut, open, shut, open, shut, open, shut. Yep, yep-yep-yep-yep-yep-yep. Nope, nope-nope-nope-nope-nope-nope. Oooweooo, oooweooo, oooweooo, oooweooo, oooweooweooweoo! [blows raspberry] [panting]

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Nailed it!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Morning, Daisy Jo! You here to pick up some cookies to go with your milk?

speaker: Daisy Jo
text: Oh ya, Pinkie, don'tcha know?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Well, Mrs. Cake just baked a fresh batch of your favorite oatmeal.

speaker: Daisy Jo
text: Mooo, sounds delightful!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh, Rose, your Calla lilies look even better than last year! I bet you'll take first prize at the flower show again.

speaker: Rose
text: Thanks, Pinkie! Would you like one?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Absolutely! [chomps] Looking fit as a fiddle, Mr. Waddle, and you're wearing my favorite tie!

speaker: Mr Waddle
text: Aw, shucks, Miss Pinkie, you flatterer you.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Well, happy birthday, Cheerilee.

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Thank *you*, Pinkie.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
